ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

ack.description: acknowledge or reject the input request

input.description: provide a json blob to the workflow

com.nokia.eda.routing.v1alpha1.Attachmen.description: AttachmentLookup is the Schema for the attachmentlookups API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to routing.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to AttachmentLookup

spec.description:
This workflow is used to look up attachments (where an address is attached in the network) on a set of nodes.
It takes an address, and an optional list of nodes (or node selectors - a list of label expressions) to perform the lookup on,
and returns the matching attachments, including the node,
network instance, prefix, interface, and next hop group ID.

address.description:
Address to perform a lookup for.
This is a standard IPv4 or IPv6 address, excluding mask or prefix length, e.g. 12.0.0.1.
address.title: Address

networkInstance.description:
Network Instance is the locally named network instance to use for the lookup.
Can be omitted if the default network instance is to be used.
networkInstance.title: Network Instance

nodeSelectors.description:
NodeSelectors is a list of node selectors to execute lookups on.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf", "eda.nokia.com/region=us-west"].
nodeSelectors.title: Node Selectors

nodes.description: Nodes is a list of node names to execute lookups on.
nodes.title: Nodes

spec.title: Specification

status.description: AttachmentLookupStatus defines the observed state of AttachmentLookup
status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.routing.v1alpha1.Attachmen.description: AttachmentLookupList is a list of attachmentlookups

com.nokia.eda.routing.v1alpha1.DefaultIn.description: DefaultInterface is the Schema for the defaultinterfaces API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to routing.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to DefaultInterface

spec.description: DefaultInterface enables the configuration of default interfaces, including Interface references, DefaultRouter, VLAN IDs, IP MTU settings, and options for IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. It also supports unnumbered interfaces and BFD (Bidirectional Forwarding Detection) configuration.

bfd.description: Enable or disable BFD on this DefaultInterface.

desiredMinTransmitInt.description: The minimum interval in microseconds between transmission of BFD control packets[default=1000000].
desiredMinTransmitInt.title: Transmit Interval

detectionMultiplier.description: The number of packets that must be missed to declare this session as down. [default=3]
detectionMultiplier.title: Multiplier

minEchoReceiveInterval.description: The minimum interval between echo packets the local node can receive in microseconds
minEchoReceiveInterval.title: Minimum Echo Receive Interval

requiredMinReceive.description: The minimum interval in microseconds between received BFD control packets that this system should support.[default=1000000].
requiredMinReceive.title: Receive Interval

ttl.description: Sets custom IP TTL or Hop Limit for multi-hop BFD sessions packets. Not applicable to single-hop BFD sessions.
ttl.title: IP TTL/Hop Limit

bfd.title: BFD Configuration

interface.description: Reference to an Interface to use for attachment.
interface.title: Interface Reference

ipMTU.description: Set the IP MTU for the DefaultInterface.
ipMTU.title: IP MTU

ipv4Addresses.description: List of IPv4 addresses in ip/mask form, e.g., 192.168.0.1/24.

primary.description: Indicates which address to use as primary for broadcast
primary.title: Primary

ipv4Addresses.title: IPv4 Addresses

ipv6Addresses.description: List of IPv6 addresses in ip/mask form, e.g., fc00::1/120.

primary.description: Indicates which address to use as primary for broadcast
primary.title: Primary

ipv6Addresses.title: IPv6 Addresses

subinterfaceIndex.description: Subinterface index to use with this DefaultInterface. Ignored for platforms that do not support subinterface index
subinterfaceIndex.title: Sub Interface Index

unnumbered.description: Enables the use of unnumbered interfaces on the ISL. For IPv6, no IP address are configured on the sub-interface and only the link local address will be used. If any allocation pool is specified for IPv6 that will take precedence and IPs will be assigned to the interfaces.  When using eBGP for an underlay protocol, the DefaultInterfaces which are a part of the ISL will be added to the BGP dynamic neighbor list.
unnumbered.title: Unnumbered

vlanID.description: VLAN to use with this DefaultInterface.
vlanID.title: VLAN ID

spec.title: Specification

status.description: DefaultInterfaceStatus defines the observed state of DefaultInterface

health.description: Indicates the health score of the DefaultInterface.
health.title: Health

healthScoreReason.description: Indicates the reason for the health score.
healthScoreReason.title: Health Score Reason

lastChange.description: Indicates when this Interface last changed state.
lastChange.title: Last Change

operationalState.description: Indicates the current operational state of the DefaultInterface.
operationalState.title: Operational State

status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.routing.v1alpha1.DefaultRo.description: DefaultRouter is the Schema for the defaultrouters API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to routing.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to DefaultRouter

spec.description: DefaultRouter enables the configuration of default routing instances on a specified Node, including options for BGP configuration, import and export policies, and router IDs.

ui-conditions.errorMsg: An autonomous system must be provided when BGP is enabled.

ebgpPreference.description: Preference to be set for eBGP.
ebgpPreference.title: eBGP Preference

enabled.description: Enables BGP in the default VRF.
enabled.title: Enable BGP

ibgpPreference.description: Preference to be set for iBGP.
ibgpPreference.title: iBGP Preference

ipv4Unicast.description: Parameters relating to the IPv4 unicast AFI/SAFI.

advertiseIPV6NextHops.description: Enables advertisement of IPv4 Unicast routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
advertiseIPV6NextHops.title: Advertise IPv6 Next Hops

allowMultipleAS.description: When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.
allowMultipleAS.title: Allow Multiple Autonomous Systems Per Path

maxAllowedPaths.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.
maxAllowedPaths.title: Maximum Number of Paths

receiveIPV6NextHops.description: Enables the advertisement of the RFC 5549 capability to receive IPv4 routes with IPv6 next-hops.
receiveIPV6NextHops.title: Receive IPv6 Next Hops

ipv4Unicast.title: IPv4 Unicast

ipv6Unicast.description: Parameters relating to the IPv6 unicast AFI/SAFI.

allowMultipleAS.description: When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.
allowMultipleAS.title: Allow Multiple Autonomous Systems Per Path

maxAllowedPaths.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.
maxAllowedPaths.title: Maximum Number of Paths

ipv6Unicast.title: IPv6 Unicast

keychain.description: Keychain to be used for authentication
keychain.title: Keychain

l2VPNEVPN.description: Parameters relating to the EVPN AFI/SAFI.

advertiseIPV6NextHops.description: Enables advertisement of EVPN routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
advertiseIPV6NextHops.title: Advertise IPv6 Next Hops

allowMultipleAS.description: When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.
allowMultipleAS.title: Allow Multiple Autonomous Systems Per Path

maxAllowedPaths.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.
maxAllowedPaths.title: Maximum Number of Paths

l2VPNEVPN.title: L2VPN EVPN

minWaitToAdvertise.description: Minimum wait time before advertising routes post BGP restart.
minWaitToAdvertise.title: Min Wait To Advertise Time

sendCommunityLarge.description: When false, all large (12 byte) BGP communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityLarge.title: Send Community Large

sendCommunityStandard.description: When false, all standard (4 byte) communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityStandard.title: Send Community Standard

waitForFibInstall.description: Wait for FIB installation before advertising routes.
waitForFibInstall.title: Wait for FIB Installation

description.description: Sets the description on the Default router.
description.title: Description

ecmp.description: Set the maximum number of ECMP paths for the DefaultRouter. This is supported only by some platforms, and will be ignored for others.
ecmp.title: Maximum ECMP Paths

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route exports from the DefaultRouter.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

importPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route imports into the DefaultRouter.
importPolicy.title: Import Policy

node.description: Reference to a TopoNode on which to configure the default routing instance.
node.title: Node

routeLeaking.description: Route leaking controlled by routing policies in and out of the DefaultRouter.

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route exports from the DefaultRouter.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

importPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route imports into the DefaultRouter.
importPolicy.title: Import Policy

routerID.title: Router ID

spec.description: Drain allows for the controlled disabling or draining of specific DefaultRouters, either by selecting them through labels or directly referencing them, ensuring traffic is safely rerouted or dropped before the routers are decommissioned.

com.nokia.eda.routing.v1alpha1.RouteLook.description: RouteLookup is the Schema for the routelookups API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to routing.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to RouteLookup

spec.description:
This workflow is used to look up routes on a set of nodes.
It takes an address, and an optional list of nodes (or node selectors - a list of label expressions) to perform the lookup on,
and returns the matching route, and the set of egress interfaces that would be used to reach it.

address.description:
Address to perform a lookup for.
This is a standard IPv4 or IPv6 address, excluding mask or prefix length, e.g. 12.0.0.1.
address.title: Address

networkInstance.description:
Network Instance is the locally named network instance to use for the lookup.
Can be omitted if the default network instance is to be used.
networkInstance.title: Network Instance

nodeSelectors.description:
Node Selectors is a list of node label selectors to execute lookups on.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf", "eda.nokia.com/region=us-west"].
nodeSelectors.title: Node Selectors

nodes.description: Nodes is a list of node names to execute lookups on.
nodes.title: Nodes

resolve.description: Resolve indicates whether indirect next hops should be resolved.
resolve.title: Resolve

spec.title: Specification

status.description: RouteLookupStatus defines the observed state of RouteLookup

localAddress.description: Local IP address of the egress interface

peerNode.description: The node this interface is connected to.

status.title: Status
